children.subject: You want to submit it the at the end of the semester in which you complete all 3 prereqs.
[OP] yea this current semester is my last prereq (took 70 over the summer) so I went ahead and submitted the form
Wait, you can fill out the form to declare CS, before knowing your declaration GPA?

history.content:
I am taking 61b right now and I will be able to make the grade cutoff unless something truly disastrous happens, but when I filled out the declaration form a few weeks ago I wasn't aware of some info so a couple things I put on there are wrong. I didn't know 370 was not counted as a technical elective yet, so in the spot where it asks you to list your planned classes to see if you will graduate on time I put that on there-- I still might have put 2 other valid tech electives so I should be good, but honestly I'm really not sure. Also, I think you had to say the number of units you have taken so far (I think including this semester) and since then, I late dropped a math class so the unit count is also inaccurate. I just want to know how big of a problem those two things are and what I can do to fix them.

I worked really hard to declare cs and I will be so hecking sad if I have to wait another semester to declare because I messed up my form and/or some of my info has changed since I filled it out :(( I heard the only thing that affects their decision is the gpa cutoff so I don't know why the two things I potentially messed up would matter, but what if someone does put some sort of infeasible schedule on their form? do they just sit you down and help you pick a better 4 (or 2 now) year plan, or do they reject your app and make you reapply? pls help :0
history.subject: how accurate does the info you put on your cs declaration form have to be?
